ygData.subject: Re: Heritrix 2 Fails to crawl seed
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Gordon, Thanks for your response! Forget the stop & stall thing, I can t reproduce this now... I think I mixed something up there... If I use the DNS

Hi Gordon,

Thanks for your response!

Forget the stop & stall thing, I can=
't reproduce this now... I think I mixed something up there...

If I use th=
e DNS address as seed I get following error:

Heritrix(-1)-Domain unresolva=
ble 
Seed has not been processed 	http://www.archive.org/
HTTP-302-Redirect=
-Found 
Seed successfully crawled 	http://207.241.229.39/

With the the HTT=
P address as seed the error is:

Failed to crawl seed, will retry http://ww=
w.archive.org/

I tried 1.4.3 for validation and got the same errors.

The =
crawl report shows :

Discovered:   	 5  	  ?
  Queued: 	3 	 ?
  In progres=
s: 	0 	 ?
	  Total 	  Successfully 	  Failed 	  Disregarded
  Finished: 	2 =
	2 	0 	0 

The crawl.log shows:

http://207.241.229.39/robots.txt P http://207.241.229.39/ text/html #017 20=

The progress-=
statistic.log shows this and retries every 20sec:

           0        24449         28856            1           3           =
3

No infos in any other reports/logs...

Could this have something to do w=
ith my router im using too?

Hope this helps?!?

Georgie

--- In archive-cr=
awler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
> sendaman69 wrote=
:
> > Hi,
> > 
> > I already posted this a while ago, but didn't get a resp=
onse! Anyone got a hint on the following problem!
> > 
> > I was using the =
the seed http://www.jku.at (domain of my university) to develop and test my=
 focused crawler based on heritrix 2. With this seed crawling worked fine.
=
> > 
> > Now I tried to use other random seed domains (e.g. http://www.arch=
ive.org) and suddenly my crawl stalls right at the start?!?
> > 
> > If I u=
se the IP adresses instead of the domain names as seeds the crawl stops and=
 does not stall!?
> 
> What is the difference between "stalls" and "stops" =
in the preceding two 
> sentences?
> 
> > I get "Failed to crawl seed, will=
 retry" in the seed report.
> 
> Is there any other number in this report?
=
> 
> Is there anything in the 'crawl.log', 'heritrix_out.log', or other log=
s 
> (runtime-errors, local/nonfatal-errors) referring to the seeds which a=
re 
> not crawled, or indicating other errors?
> 
> Does the crawl.log show=
 success for the automatic prerequisites of the 
> seed URI (eg: dns:www.ar=
chive.org and http://www.archive.org/robots.txt)?
> 
> > I tried it with th=
e standard unchanged 2.0.2 distribution and the standard profiles and got t=
he same result?!?
> 
> Starting from a standard profile, and simply making =
the minimal changes 
> necessary to enable a crawl (adding seeds and a cust=
om user-agent), 
> should have no problem at least attempting the seeds.
> =

> > Anyone got an explanation for this strange behavior?
> > 
> > Im runni=
ng on windows and from localhost:8080 from my home (which is not part of th=
e jku.at domain)
> 
> Which Windows?
> 
> While Heritrix works on Windows -=
- indeed my primary development machine 
> is WindowsXP -- our primary targ=
et platform is Linux. So it's possible 
> some things will be flaky in a Wi=
ndows environment, especially if using 
> something we haven't ever tested =
(like Vista/Win7, running the crawl 
> from/to Windows network volumes, run=
ning at odd installation paths, etc.).
> 
> I would expect any such problem=
s to generate noticeable errors in the 
> UI, heritrix_out.log, or elsewher=
e, though.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
> 
> 
> > Thanks for any help
> > 
> > Georgi=
e

roups Links
